title: Montpelier, Vermont
summary: Montpelier (/mɒntˈpiːliər/)[6] is the capital city of the U.S. state of Vermont and the seat of Washington County. The site of Vermont's state government, it is the least populous state capital in the United States.[7] As of the 2020 census, the population was 8,074. However, the daytime population grows to about 21,000, due to the large number of jobs within city limits.[8] The Vermont College of Fine Arts is located in the municipality. It was named after Montpellier, a city in the south of France.[9]
